scenario.context: An Assistant (Sam) tries to discuss a project issue, but the User (manager) constantly gets distracted and goes off-topic.

transcript.speaker: assistant
transcript.text: Thanks for making time. You mentioned there was an issue with my communication on the Phoenix project that you wanted to discuss?

transcript.speaker: user
transcript.text: Right, the project. You know, that reminds me, did you see the game last night? Incredible finish. I can't believe they pulled it off.

transcript.speaker: assistant
transcript.text: I didn't get a chance to watch it. I would like to understand the issue you mentioned so I can address it. Could you tell me more?

transcript.speaker: user
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah, the issue. It's important to stay on track. Speaking of tracks, I was thinking of going hiking this weekend. The weather is supposed to be amazing. You into hiking?

transcript.speaker: assistant
transcript.text: I appreciate you asking, but I want to make sure we resolve the feedback topic first. It's important to me that I understand where I can improve. Could we go back to that?

transcript.speaker: user
transcript.text: Totally. You're right. So, the feedback is... you need to be more... present. Like my dog when he sees a squirrel. He's a Golden Retriever, absolutely fantastic dog. I should show you pictures sometime.

transcript.speaker: assistant
transcript.text: I'm finding it difficult to follow how that relates to my work on the project. Can we try to define one specific action I can take based on your feedback?

transcript.speaker: user
transcript.text: Action... Right. Action movies! Saw a great one the other day. Anyway, good chat. We should do this again.
